required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Study Evaluating the Safety, Tolerability and Pharmacokinetics of Desvenlafaxine Succinate SR in Healthy Chinese Male and Females
clinical_study.official_title: Ascending Single Dose Study of the Safety, Tolerability, Pharmacokinetics, and Pharmacodynamics of Desvenlafaxine Succinate Sustained Release Administered Orally to Healthy Chinese Subjects.

lead_sponsor.agency: Wyeth is now a wholly owned subsidiary of Pfizer

clinical_study.source: Wyeth is now a wholly owned subsidiary of Pfizer

brief_summary.textblock: The main purpose of this study is to evaluate the safety and tolerability of desvenlafaxine succinate SR in healthy male and female Chinese subjects. The amount of drug in the body and the effects of the drug will also be evaluated.

primary_outcome.measure: Safety and tolerability as evaluated from reported adverse events, scheduled physical examinations, vital sign measurements, cardiac rhythm monitoring, 12 lead ECG and clinical laboratory results.

secondary_outcome.measure: Pharmacokinetics as evaluated from blood and urine concentrations of desvenlafaxine

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion:
1. Men or non-pregnant, non-lactating women, 18 to 45 years of age inclusive on study day 1.
2. Healthy as determined by the investigator on the basis of medical history, physical examination, clinical laboratory test results, vital signs, and 12-lead electrocardiogram (ECG)
3. Nonsmoker or smoker of fewer than 10 cigarettes (half a pack) a day.
Exclusion:
1. Any significant cardiovascular, hepatic, renal, respiratory, gastrointestinal, endocrine, immunologic, dermatologic, hematologic, neurologic, or psychiatric disease.
2. History of epilepsy or seizure disorder (except history of a single childhood febrile seizure).

overall_official.affiliation: Wyeth is now a wholly owned subsidiary of Pfizer
